items.sentence: I\'m pretty sure that Tom believed everything I told him.
What\'s the best Christmas present you\'ve ever received?
Everyone who worked on that project became a millionaire.
He walked slowly so the children would be able to follow.
How long does it take to walk from here to the city hall?
My parents are opposed to my sister marrying a foreigner.
My thirteen-year-old is going on her first date tomorrow.
No one has the right to tell you how to raise your child.
Not only does he speak French, he can also speak English.
Parents are responsible for the safety of their children.
I don\'t think Tom knows when Mary will leave for Boston.
I had intended to finish this yesterday, but I couldn\'t.
I never imagined we\'d be talking about this topic today.
Tom likes Boston better than any other place he\'s lived.
I thought about throwing it away, but decided to keep it.
I thought it was unusual that he was up so late at night.
I thought something was going to happen, but nothing did.
I thought you might be hungry, so I made some sandwiches.
I had pizza for lunch, so I don\'t want pizza for dinner.
I wouldn\'t be surprised if Tom got kicked out of school.
